description: Expresses the action of returning to a previous state, place, or condition
explanation:
### Name
- Nに戻る

### Meaning and function
- Expresses “to return/go back to N” (a place) or “to revert to N” (a previous state/condition)

### Form and templates
- Core:
  - N(place/state) に 戻る
  - Polite: N に 戻ります
  - Plain past/negative: 戻った／戻らない；Polite past/negative: 戻りました／戻りません
- Alternatives:
  - N(place) へ 戻る (directional; places only. Use に for a specific destination/result)
  - Perspective: N に 戻ってくる (“come back (to here)”) / N に 戻っていく (“go back (away from here)”)
- Common state-noun patterns:
  - 元(もと) に 戻る (back to the original state)
  - 元のN に 戻る / 前のN に 戻る (back to the previous N)
  - 一般的に、状態名詞＋に＋戻る で「その状態に戻る」の意味になる（例：正常に戻る は「正常な状態に戻る」）
- Particle ordering:
  - Time and destination can both take に: [Time] に + [Place/State] に + 戻る is natural

### Usage notes and constraints
- Register: Neutral and very common in both speech and writing. Use ます/です for polite contexts.
- Semantics:
  - 戻る is intransitive (自動詞): the subject itself goes/reverts back
  - Use に with places and with result states; へ is acceptable only for general direction to places, not for abstract states
  - Very common formula for states: 元(もと)に戻る / 元のNに戻る
  - With some な-adjectives, に can mark the result state (正常に戻る = “return to normal”); beware that with many adjectives に can also be adverbial (“do X quietly”), so 元(もと)に戻る / 元のNに戻る is clearer for beginners
- Contrast with similar verbs:
  - 帰る is mainly “go (back) home/to one’s base.” Use 戻る for returning to a place you were just before (not necessarily home) or for reverting to a state. 帰る is not used for abstract states.
- Orthography:
  - 戻る and もどる are both acceptable; kanji is common
  - 元 and もと are both seen; 元に戻る is a fixed and very common collocation
- UI/labels:
  - In buttons/links, 〜へ戻る and simply 戻る are common for “go back (to previous screen/page)”

### Common mistakes (optional, only if relevant)
- Using を with 戻る (戻る is intransitive). To “put something back,” use 戻す: NをNに戻す
- Using へ with states (e.g., “to normal”)—use に for result states
- Overusing 戻る when 帰る is natural for “go home”
- Assuming な-adj＋に＋戻る always marks a result; it can also be an adverb (“return quietly”). Use 元(もと)に/元のNに for unambiguous “revert” meaning

### Related grammar (optional, only if relevant)
- Nに帰る: “return (home/base).” Not used for abstract states
- NをNに戻す: transitive counterpart “return/put X back to N; restore X to N”
- Nになる / Nにする: general change into N (become/make) vs に戻る “revert back to N”
- 返す／返る: “return (something to someone)” vs “be returned” (object transfer), not “go back/revert” in the state sense

examples.jp: すぐ駅に戻る。
examples.en: I’ll go back to the station soon.

examples.jp: 先ほど会社へ戻りました。
examples.en: I went back to the office a little while ago.

examples.jp: こちらに戻ってきてください。
examples.en: Please come back here.

examples.jp: 彼は静かに席へ戻っていった。
examples.en: He quietly went back to his seat.

examples.jp: すべてが元に戻った。
examples.en: Everything returned to its original state.

examples.jp: 体温はもう平熱に戻りました。
examples.en: My temperature has already returned to normal.

examples.jp: 画面が元の表示に戻った。
examples.en: The screen returned to the original display.

examples.jp: 彼女は前の職場に戻らない。
examples.en: She won’t go back to her previous workplace.

examples.jp: 早く学校に戻りたい。
examples.en: I want to go back to school soon.

examples.jp: 三時にオフィスに戻ります。
examples.en: I’ll return to the office at three.

examples.jp: 来週の月曜日に通常運行に戻る予定です。
examples.en: We plan to return to normal operation next Monday.

examples.jp: この通りは徐々ににぎわいに戻ってきた。
examples.en: This street has gradually returned to its bustle.

examples.jp: 元どおりにもどりましたか。
examples.en: Has it returned to the way it was?

examples.jp: 明日までに元の生活に戻れますか。
examples.en: Will we be able to return to our former life by tomorrow?

examples.jp: まだ正常に戻っていません。
examples.en: It hasn’t returned to normal yet.

examples.jp: では、前の画面へ戻ってください。
examples.en: Then please go back to the previous screen.

examples.jp: 家に戻るのは何時ごろになりそうですか。
examples.en: About what time do you think you’ll be back home?

examples.jp: 会議が終わったら、各自の席に戻ってください。
examples.en: When the meeting is over, please return to your seats.

examples.jp: 電車は平常運転に戻った。
examples.en: The trains have returned to normal service.

examples.jp: 昨日は通常営業に戻りませんでした。
examples.en: We didn’t return to normal business yesterday.

negativeExamples.en: Put the book back on the shelf.

negativeExamples.jp: 昨日は全然戻らなかった。
negativeExamples.en: It didn’t come back at all yesterday.

negativeExamples.jp: 正常になるまで待ちます。
negativeExamples.en: I’ll wait until it becomes normal.

negativeExamples.jp: この資料をもとに話します。
negativeExamples.en: I’ll talk based on this document.

negativeExamples.jp: アプリが固まって、戻るボタンが反応しない。
negativeExamples.en: The app froze and the Back button doesn’t respond.
